titleStmt.title: On ye Death of ye Duke of Orleans

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: by Mr 08: Pope
How vain are Mortals mans Endeavours?
Said att James his Master Travers.
Good Orleans dead! in truth 'tis hard:──
Oh, may all Statesmen dy prepared!
I do foresee──(and in foreseeing
He equals any man in being)
The Army ne'er can be disbanded──
──I wish ye King were safely landed.
Ah Friends, great changes threat this land──
All France & England's att a Stand.
Theres Mire-Weys, yt makes strange work,
And Theres ye Czar, & Theres ye Turk;
The Pope────an Indian Merchant by
Cutt short his Speech with this reply.
Things att a stand! why dread such changes?
Ah Sr, You never saw the Ganges──
There dwelt a Race (we call 'em Monkeyes)
Grave, sober, sage, like our Quid-nunc-ys:
On either Bank, from bough to bough,
they meet and chatt, as we do now.
Whispers go round; they grin, they Shrug;
They bow, they snarl, they scratch, they hugg:
And just as chance, or whim provoke 'em,
They either bite their friends, or stroke 'em.
There overy have I seen some active Prig,
to shew his parts, bestride a Twig.
Ld! How ye Chattering Tribe admire!
Not that he's wiser, but is higher:
All long to try the venturous thing;
For power is but to have ones swing.
From side to side he Springs, he spurns,
And bangs his Foes, & friends by turns:
Thus as in giddy Freaks he bounces,
Crack goes ye Twig & in he flounces.
Down ye swift stream the wretch is born,
Never, Ah, never to return.
Z────ds what a fall has our dear Brother!
Morbleu, crys one, & D──mnee t'other.
The nations give a general screech;
None cocks his tail; none claws his Br──ch:
Each trembles for ye Publick weal,
And for a while forgett to steal:
A while all eyes, intent & steddy,
Persue him whirling down ye Eddy:
But out of mind, when out of view,
Some other mounts ye twigg a·new;
And Business, on each Monkey Shore,
Runs ye same tract it went before.Y20-340L
